lines.text: I'm sorry, but you're not on the guest list.
That's because we're not guests. We're looking for a man with a mole on his nose.
A mole on his nose?
A mole on his nose.

[to Maddie]
What kind of clothes?

[to David]
What kind of clothes?
What kind of clothes do you suppose?
What kind of clothes do I suppose would be worn by a man with a mole on his nose? Who knows?
Did I happen to mention, did I bother to disclose, that this man that we're seeking with the mole on his nose? I'm not sure of his clothes or anything else, except he's Chinese, a big clue by itself.
How do you do that?
Gotta read a lot of Dr. Seuss.

I'm sorry to say, I'm sad to report, I haven't seen anyone at all of that sort. Not a man who's Chinese with a mole on his nose with some kind of clothes that you can't suppose. So get away from this door and get out of this place, or I'll have to hurt you - put my foot in your face.
I remember when they told Sylvia Plath, "Hey, Syl, cheer up!" I remember when they told e. e. cummings, "e, baby; use caps!" But did ol' e listen? No. Little n. Little o.
[Reading a ransom note]
"Exactly"'s all in capital letters. What do you think that means?
I think it means exactly what it says.
Wipe that stupid grin off your face.
This is the smartest grin I know.
I know who he is, he paints naked girls.
Nudes.
Nudes, right. Nakeds have staples in them.
You are eye crust!
The better to see you with, my dear.
You are navel lint!
Expensive navel lint.
You are...
Don't go much lower, they'll take us off the air.

[Agnes and Clara DiPesto are being chased by smugglers]
Where's Dave and Maddie?
They're not in this episode.
And then last night, an idea hit me!
Left a bruise, I hope.
Who is the one person out there, who is spreading happiness and joy out there in the world?
Steven Spielberg?
SANTY CLAUS!
Well, let me remind you Mr. Addison, that one case does not a detective make.
Well, let me remind you Ms. Hayes, that I HATE IT WHEN YOU TALK BACKWARDS.
Do bears bear? Do bees be?
You can't just burst in here like that.
Oh yeah? Tell that to the writers.
Good husband, are we married merrily?
Yea, verily, we are married merrily... though at first warily, and unfortunately quite sterilely.
David, I just don't think...

[interrupting]
That's okay, you look good.
You see through me, Kate. No tuner I. But I wish it were within my talents to play piano for you.
'Tis a sad thing indeed. You're the only man I know who suffereth from pianist envy.
Stay! Didst I hear, "I come to wive it wealthily in Padua?"
Pray sir, yea sir, I dare say I did say.
Yea sir, you do say you did say?
Yea, I say, but why do you bray? Do not gainsay what I say that we may make headway. I foray this way that I may be home ere midday.
Hooray for this day and the words that you say and forgive my display, but I have something to say.
Then without further delay, I say, fire away!
[Maddie grabs David by the throat]
Addison! You better figure out a way to get me off this train!
Whoa! Lady, I will gladly get you off this train. I will throw you off this train, if necessary, but kindly refrain from any physical act that is not of an erotic nature.
Brian Baker called me names. Preston Holt lied to me. Omar Gaus mocked me. I don't think I like men anymore.
We still like you.
I didn't even know you had a brother.
Never thought of him as a brother - just mom and dad's science project.
Do math majors multiply? Do eggs get laid?
What about this banquet? I don't want to go.
We're going. It's very important.
Important for what? Okay, it will give us a chance to fight in public, but what else?
I wouldn't want you losing any more sleep over me.
Believe me, if and when I ever find myself over you, the last thing I'll be thinking about is sleeping.
Since when did my personal life outside the office become fair game for your amusement inside the office?
If I remember correctly, since you started working here.
You're an animal!
Exactly.
And what does that mean?
The male of the species engages in sexual congress no less than forty-six thousand, five hundred and three times from the time he is thirteen until the time he runs out of ammo.
You know that and you can't remember our zip code?
Do ducks duck?
Do flies fly?
[picking Maddie up at Police station]
Why is my client being held at this hour, and why isn't it by me?
Get serious? Maddie, I just touched your rear end, if I get any more serious they're gonna move us to cable!

[Maddie is displeased that David has been leading the staff in a limbo contest while she has been out of the office]
Hiya boss! Back from the dentist so soon?
If people are meant to be together, they'll find each other, no matter where, no matter what, right? Isn't that right?
Just when I think you've gone as low as you can go, you find a basement door!
You have the morals of rabbit, the character of a slug, and the brain of a platypus.
David, may I please have some ANSWERS?
Delaware, all of the above, 90 degrees.
That man belongs in a pound.
Pound of what?
Unhand me!
I'll try, but I don't think they'll come off!

It is plain the whole town knoweth of the deal 'twixt me and Petruchio. And if the whole town knoweth, then 'tis possible that Kate knoweth. And if Kate knoweth and knoweth that the whole town knoweth and knoweth that we knoweth that she knoweth - knowest what that means?
No-eth.
I had no idea.
That's okay. I got lots of 'em. I'll loan you one.
Mr. Addison. Here's your ticket.
Thanks again, Agnes.
I guess this means you're going away.
Agnes, in all my born days I have never met a person who could put two and two together faster than you.
Math was always my strongest subject.
Does Spock beam up?

[scaring Maddie]
Hey lady, want to lick my mail!
So gather the kids, the dog, Grandma... and lock them in another room. And sit back and enjoy this very special episode of Moonlighting.
Six bullets... SIX BULLETS!
[Turns around corner to confront the gun wielding man, who fires at him]
That guy carries extra bullets. I hate that
Fire at Will! Or Al, or Harry! Or whoever the hell else you can hit!
This place was great before Miss Hayes came along. Fun times, no rules, no deadlines.
No cases.
I had no idea!
We've known that for a while.

[chasing David, who's on top of a hot air balloon]
I'm coming!
Good for you!
This is him, Edward O'Leary. Recognize him?
I don't know, we never knew him.
Then what did you want to look at the body for?
What did we want to look at the body for?
We're private detectives. It's what we do.
You wanna look at any others while you're here?
No thanks. Our limit is one stiff per day.
Could've fooled me.
A gnat with a lobotomy could fool you.
Boy, are you a tough customer. I bet you didn't even clap your hands to save Tinkerbell.
I got an idea!
Excuse me?

An idea. You know, an original thought. You've heard of them. Anyway, I was just lying in my bed last night, just lying there, feeling terrible about telling that poor man that he couldn't write Mrs. Woodley anymore, when suddenly, BA-BING! I get this idea...
Ba-what?
Huh?
Ba-what? I thought I just heard you say ba-bing.
Ba-bing? So what if I did say ba-bing? So what? Anyway, David, I suddenly realized - why are you looking at me like that?
Huh?
Why are you looking at me like that?
You're doing me.
I'm WHAT?

You're doing me, Maddie. You come in here, you slam the door, you say ba-bing, you sit on the corner of that desk - I know what I'm talking about, Maddie Hayes. This is not just some idea I plucked out of my head willy-nilly - now I'm doing you!
David! Are you all right?
Trust me Maddie, we are doing this backwards. Let's just go to your office and start all over.
David! Can I have a minute of your time, please?
Take two, they're small.

[singing]
I told you I love ya, now get out.

[to pregnant Maddie]
Louder. You're shouting for two now.
That's your trouble, David - you think hot sex cures everything.
Well, it is an effective treatment for localized high blood pressure in males.

What committee decided to put the kibosh on love and replace it with "relationships"? A relationship is when two people see a lot of each other while they wait for something better to come along. And then one day you wake up, realize you had a crack at some really great people, but were too busy worrying about what you might be missing, to notice.
You look awful.
Yeh, well, you smell awful.
